CVE-2018-15919.summary: Remotely observable behaviour in auth-gss2.c in OpenSSH through 7.8 could be used by remote attackers to detect existence of users on a target system when GSS2 is in use. NOTE: the discoverer states 'We understand that the OpenSSH developers do not want to treat such a username enumeration (or "oracle") as a vulnerability.'

CVE-2018-15473.summary: OpenSSH through 7.7 is prone to a user enumeration vulnerability due to not delaying bailout for an invalid authenticating user until after the packet containing the request has been fully parsed, related to auth2-gss.c, auth2-hostbased.c, and auth2-pubkey.c.

CVE-2017-15906.summary: The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does not properly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackers to create zero-length files.

We use cookies on our website. By continuing to browse our site, you are agreeing to our use of cookies. Find out more about our cookies please visit our Cookies Page. Close

Scottish Assessors

Search tips
  • Search the SAA site’s pages. You can use the Rateable Value or Council Tax Band searches to find information about properties
  • Search for any words you enter
  • A page containing all the words you search for is ranked higher than one with only some of the words
  • To search for a phrase put your phrase in double quotes

Welcome to the Scottish Assessors Association Portal

Information regarding Council Tax, valuation for rating and electoral registration can be found on this site. The SAA Portal provides all Scotland Valuation Rolls & Council Tax Lists on-line.

For information about your area

Select your Assessor from the local council area list below

To Search for a Rateable Value

Enter an address or post code below

Search tips Advanced Search
  • If you know the postcode, just enter that in the search box
  • If you do not know the postcode, just enter the street name into the search box
  • If you are searching for a house or apartment, then you should be using the “Council Tax Bands” search
  • If you still cannot find the property you are searching for, contact your local Assessor
  • Your local Assessor can be found by selecting your local area from this site’s home page
  • If you wish to search using the Assessor’s Property Reference Number (UARN), there is an option available for this purpose in the advanced search facility
×

To Search for a Council Tax band

Enter an address or post code below

Search tips
  • If you know the postcode, just enter that in the search box
  • If you do not know the postcode, just enter the street name into the search box
  • If you are searching for business premises, then you should be using the “Rateable Values” search
  • If you still cannot find the property you are searching for, contact your local Assessor
  • Your local Assessor can be found by selecting your local area from this site’s home page
×

Notice Board

3 August 2018

Licensed premises practice note

The licensed premises practice note has been updated following the provision of additional information from the licensed trade. This is a technical update that may alter the analysis of rental information and corresponding valuations where an appeal is in place.

The updated PN is available here

29 June 2018

SAA Annual Report for 2017/18

The SAA’s first annual report is available here

SAA Annual Report 2017/18

27 April 2018

New website for Valuation Appeal Committee decisions

The Scottish Valuation Appeal Committee Forum has launched a new website https://scotvac.org
This website provides VAC contact details and links to hearing lists. VACs will also publish valuation appeal decisions on this website.

Scottish Valuation Appeal Committees website

7 February 2018

Barclay Review Action Plan update

The action plan first published on 29 September 2017 has been updated with the progress that has been achieved by Assessors towards implementation of improvements to the rating system highlighted by the Barclay Review Group’s recommendation 12.

Barclay Report Recommendation 12 – SAA Action Plan

30 January 2018

Shooting Rights and Deer Forests information forms

Work is currently being carried out to ensure that Assessors have the remainder of shooting rights and deer forests valued. Land Managers and their agents should look out for any information requests from Assessors and ensure they are completed and returned.

6 December 2017

Scottish Rating Surveyors Forum

A new forum is being established for rating surveyors practising in Scotland to meet with representatives of the Scottish Assessors’ Association and other stakeholders such as the Scottish Government. The first meeting of this new forum will take place in the Scottish Government offices at Victoria Quay in Leith at 14:00hrs on 29 January 2018. Surveyors who wish to attend should forward their details to the Secretary of the SAA, Gary Bennett (gary.bennett@lanarkshire-vjb.gov.uk), prior to 22 January. An agenda will be circulated in advance and minutes of the meeting will be published on this website.
